intro: Seseli rigidum var. purpurascens, commonly known as purple-stemmed rigid seseli, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its stiff, upright stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
